fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After using the Confluence Conversion feature, that converts pages from the old editor to Fabric, sometimes unsupported macros get converted wrongly and show some editing options to them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a page in the old editor;
# Make sure this page contains an image within a table, for example;
# If the page is eligible for the conversion, it will show the conversion tool, so convert it to the new editor;
# Click over the image to change its size.
 
h3. Expected Results
The resizing options are shown below the image.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence shows an edit icon that leads us to a broken dialog box.

h3. Workaround
Remove and re-add the macro/image.
fields.summary: Converted pages are showing editing options for some unsupported macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A second scrollbar appears around page content when creating a page using the `meeting notes` template.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a page with a `meeting notes` template
 # Step 2 Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
It should show only one scroll bar.

h3. Actual Results
There are two scrollbars: 1 for the page and 1 extra for the page content

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: A second scrollbar appears around page content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Upon disabling the blueprint template in the space settings  content tools > templates, if you choose to disable a few templates or even only one, after reloading the page, the template is not disabled, or if the template is disabled, another template disabled before is enabled instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space
 # Go to the space settings, content tools > templates
 # Disable all the templates under Blueprint templates section
 # Reload the page
 # Try to disable the blueprints templates again by clicking on disable
 # Reload the page again

h3. Expected Results
The blueprints are disabled as designed.

h3. Actual Results
The blueprint templates are disabled, however upon reloading the page, blueprints are back again, sometimes randomly templates are disabled or enabled instead.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Disabling blueprints templates on a space level don't work as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for links in Confluence, no results are shown. The usage of wildcards or escaping characters in wildcard searches as suggested in our documentation does not work as expected. Here is the documentation:

[*Confluence Search Syntax*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-search-syntax-724765423.html]

!WildcardSearches.png|width=478,height=201!

Searching for [http://], https:// or any combination of those, will return all links present in your instance. Keep in mind that searching for http or https will return the links that are not secure or are secure, respectively. 
 *In HTTP*
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-15 at 15.04.46.png|width=255,height=169!

*In HTTPS*
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-15 at 15.04.53.png|width=262,height=176!

Searching for http or http* returns the same results, even though a wildcard has been added.

Also, as soon as the rest of the link is inserted (everything after ://), the page that contains the link is no longer shown in the results, with or without wildcards:

*Only Http*
 !SearchHTTTPS.png|width=280,height=174!

*Rest of the link with wildcard*
 !SearchHTTPS2.png|width=287,height=117!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Insert an external link (example: [https://mynewlink.com/guest])
 # Publish the page
 # Search for **mynewlink***, /.***mynewlink.**/, mynewlink or any other combination

h3. Expected Results

The search results contain the page in which the link was placed.
h3. Actual Results

No results are found
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching for external links does not work as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inline comments get resolved when you click on the Grammarly button in edit mode
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Grammarly plugin.
 # Create a page. write something.
 # Add inline comments.
 # Open page in Edit Mode. Click on the Green Grammarly button at the button left.  !image-2020-04-15-15-25-44-505.png!
 # A pop-up with the page content will appear, Close it.
 # Publish the page.
 # All Inline comments are resolved on its own.

h3. Expected Results

The Inline comments should not be resolved.
h3. Actual Results

The Inline comments get resolved on clicking the Grammarly button.
h3. Workaround
 Don't use the extension. 
 OR 
 Turn off for the conf-cloud site.
 !image-2020-04-15-15-25-23-302.png!
fields.summary: Inline comments get resolved when you click on the Grammarly button in edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While trying to perform a custom page export for a page in a space with more than 5000 pages, an error is returned:
{code:java}
The payload for this space export exceeded current limit. Please remove/migrate some pages from this space and retry or do a full export instead. If none of the mentioned method works, please contact your administrator for help.
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to space setting
 # Go to Content tools> export> custom export
 # Select a single page from the space (or a page with a couple of child pages)
 # Click export.

h3. Expected Results

The page(s) is exported successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The page fails to export with the error
{code:java}
The payload for this space export exceeded current limit. Please remove/migrate some pages from this space and retry or do a full export instead. If none of the mentioned method works, please contact your administrator for help.
{code}
Backend log:
{code:java}
Cannot export space spacekey <KEY> because the payload size exceeds the current char limit of 32768{code}
(i) The backend log can be also displayed in the UI.
h3. Workaround

Use a full space export instead
fields.summary: Custom space export limit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Importing Team Calendars via .ICS does not import event color or user

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create custom even on Team Calendar and assign a user to it and a color
# Export the calendar from the Confluence instance to a .ICS format file
# Import the .ICS file in to new Confluence Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results

Custom event colors remain the same as well as the 'who' field for the event.

h3. Actual Results

Random color is assigned to the event and the 'who' field is empty.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Importing Team Calendars via .ICS does not import event color or user

fields.description:
I'm a big user of tables within confluence pages in order to stay organized.  I do have a couple of situations where my tales have been edited a dew times now and are not properly sorted in either the"View Mode or "Edit Modem".  Obviously in "View Mode", you can hit the column header and sort said columns, but in "edit mode" there is not that capability.  I'd like to be able to sort in "Edit mode" and have that sort carry into "View Mode". 

Thanks for the consideration,

Jeff
fields.summary: Confluence Page - Table Editor

fields.description:
Is there a way, when attaching a document to a confluence page, that when in "view mode" only the file name is displayed ?  Much the same as if it was a http link...  On the previous version of the editor and view mode, a pdf file, for example, would show a nice look at the first page of the document.  Now the square isn't pretty and kind of bulky.

 

Thanks for the consideration.

Jeff
fields.summary: Confluence Attachments

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

 
 #  Open any page in view mode
 # Navigate to space overview page
 # Copy the URL
 # Paste the URL to any page

 

*Expected result:* Link resolves into smart card

*Actual result:* Link doesn't resolve into smart card

*Version:* CLASSIC-HOTFIX-RELEASE-CLASSIC-master-2038-2 (prod)
fields.summary: Link to space overview with ?homepageId parameter doesn't resolve into smart card
Inserting an Attachments macro into a Space Template throws a rendering error, when previewing the template, after saving it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I tried to provide feedback on a bug that exists when updating the Jira Issue/Filter Macro and after adding the information and submitting the information the issue does not appear in the list of Jira issues Reported by me. 
In addition, it does not appear that an email or issue number was created and sent. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Open a Confluence page: Example  [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/BB/pages/edit-v2/680268201]
 # Step 2: Click to edit the page
 # Click on the `Feedback` word at the bottom right corner of the page. 
 # Added information to the form displayed
 # Submit the information
 # Log in to Jira.atlassian.com
 # In the Navigation bar at the top of the page, use the Issues dropdown 
 # Select Reported By me.
 # The issue does not appear.
 # Check your email. - No email sent. 

h3. Expected Results

Ability to provide feedback 

Ability to get a confirmation email and issue ticket number after submitting feedback. 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Unable to give feedback On Hello page and create Issue ticket

fields.description:
Very annoying - there is no 'Preview' button, next to the 'Publish' and 'Close' buttons.
Yes, I know the 'Preview' functionality is there in a submenu and hotkey. Both of which are good. But not having it NEXT TO THE PUBLISH BUTTON is bad.
Yes, it only takes 0.5 seconds to click on the menu, drag down a few millimetres, and select it. Or I can put down my mouse / pen, place my hands on the keyboard & do the (non-intuitive) "CTRL-SHIFT-E" in about 1.5 seconds. Add that up 50-100 times a week, plus having the microagression every single time... it escalates quickly.
fields.summary: Missing a 'Preview Page' button

fields.description:
How do you embed an image (or video) that was uploaded to another page in your workspace? 

Images no longer have names or tags anymore? 

If you copy the URL of a image, it shows the text of the link, not the image itself. And that link is useless 404 death. 
The "Files & images" button is utterly WORTHLESS, because it only shows what _*I*_ uploaded recently. It does allow me to browse 'GIPHY' though - which is a feature that a serious production tool should never, ever include. ("Haha, this goofy loop I found would fit PERFECTLY into my official team documentation!")
It is absolutely ludicrous to have to UPLOAD the SAME IMAGE again. But that seems to be what we need to do? 
If it's not what we need to do, then me not knowing what I DO NEED to do is a serious UI design fail.
Why o why did Atlassian FIX SO MANY THINGS THAT WEREN'T BROKEN?
fields.summary: Referencing an image or video

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Office macro, you can choose to display the attachment that is on a different page. If you do that, the Office macro won't allow you to save. Nothing happens when hitting the Save button. 

This affects the following macros: PDF, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word macros.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page.
 # Attach a PDF/Word/PowerPoint/Excel file to the page.
 # Create another page.
 # Add Office PDF/Word/PowerPoint/Excel macro.
 # Select the attachment from the first page created.
 # Try to insert the attachment using insert/save button in the macro.

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to insert attachment successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happening when we click on the insert button.
h3. Workaround

Currently, it works if the attachment itself is *attached to the same page* you want to use the Office macro.
fields.summary: Unable to save/insert in the Office Macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
+ sign to create the space is showing, on Confluence's Home, to the users who have no create space permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Global Permissions page, untick "Create space" option for all groups/users
 # Go to the Home page and attempt to create space

h3. Expected Results
+ sign is hidden from the users who have no create space permission.

h3. Actual Results
+ sign is showing to all users. 
 !image-2020-04-13-12-04-26-756.png|thumbnail! 
Users who have no create space permission is seeing infinite loading on the "Create Space" screen.
 !image-2020-04-13-12-04-47-700.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Create Space" button displayed despite the user having no "Create Space" permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inline image is broken after migration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Tinymce page
# add some text
# add inline image
# migrate to new editor
# Open it for edit

h3. Expected Results
 * image should have settings panel below with alignments, wrapping, alt, link, annotation settings
 * should be possible to open image in preview mode
 * edit popup appears uncuted

h3. Actual Results
 * settings panel is absent
 * impossible to open image in preview
 * edit popup for image is cuted
see attachment

h3. Workaround
# Create a new page
# Move to a new Fabric page instead of using the TinyMCE migrated to Fabric page
fields.summary: Inline image is broken after migration

fields.description:
As of May 2020, support has ended for the following Gadgets in Confluence Cloud:
 * Activity Stream
 * Confluence Page Gadget
 * Confluence Quick Nav Gadget
 * News gadget

Any existing instances of these gadgets will still work. However, you won't be able to insert them into the legacy editor or the new editor using the macro browser, slash command, or a shortcut key. Atlassian will not longer fix bugs related to these gadgets.

[Gadgets|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/gadgets-724765454.html] were designed to allow you to display information dynamically from sources like iGoogle or Jira, for example, in Confluence. The first gadgets were introduced in the early versions of Confluence Server, and the technology they used is now obsolete. Since then we have also implemented a number of better ways to display dynamic information using macros and other integration points.


This suggestion will track your feedback around Confluence gadgets.
fields.summary: Feedback around the ability to add new Confluence gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
New changes on Status Macro removed the strong colors from Status and replace it to a lighter color. This change is affecting people with color blindness, and it's preventing from seeing the difference between two statuses. 

h3. Before the change 
Old Status colors
 !Old Status Colors.png|thumbnail! 

h3. After the change
New Status colors
 !New Status Colors.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion:
Use something similar to Trello's colorblind friendly mode:
https://wearecolorblind.com/examples/trello-colorblind-friendly-mode/
fields.summary: New changes on Status Macro are difficult to see for people with color blindness

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user references to the Confluence Wiki Markup here [*Confluence Wiki Markup*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-wiki-markup-938044804.html] while using the New Editor (Fabric), results are not what is described within the documentation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using the _+New Editor+_ (Fabric)
 # Try to insert Markup
 # Try following the official documentation from Atlassian

h3. Expected Results

The documentation is consistent and takes in consideration both environments available for Confluence Cloud.
h3. Actual Results

The documentation works solely for the +_Legacy Editor_+ (tinyMCE). The new editor is not mentioned within the page.
h3. Workaround

Use the Legacy Editor (tinyMCE). This should be available for every customer. If it is not, the customer can request it, as explained here:
 [*Change to your content is in your hands*|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476]
h2. Suggested Resolution

Update Atlassian offical document to reflect the existence of our New Editor (Fabric) and how the presented features are reflected in it. According to this request, markup is not available in the New Editor (Fabric):

[*Support Wiki Markup for the new editor*|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65756]
fields.summary: Following the Confluence Wiki Markup documentation does not work for the New Editor (Fabric)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, when a user nests an Expand Macro inside a table cell, the usage of any kind of automatic list (numbered or bulleted) is disabled. 
The insertion of normal text still works.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using the New Editor (Fabric)
 # Insert a table
 # Insert an Expand Macro inside any of the table cells
 # Try to create a bulleted/numbered list

h3. Expected Results
The list options are available for the user to select and use.


h3. Actual Results
 The listed list options are both greyed out.
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-10 at 13.06.50.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, the only workaround to this is using the Legacy Editor (tinyMCE). Every customer has the power to use it. If it is not available for you, it can be requested as explained here:
[*Atlassian Community - Change to your content is in your hands*|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476]

Here is what it looks like in the Legacy Editor:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-10 at 13.05.26.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Nesting an Expand Macro inside a Table cell in the New Editor disables the option to insert both Numbered and Bulleted lists
After submission make ccgraphQL schema change
Chopper process, feedback fixes
Obtain feature flag and wrap entire change behind it
Implement content search for ancestor with imposing restriction for group
Implement content search for ancestor with imposing restriction for user
Implement space permissions check for groups
Implement space permissions for users

fields.description:
https://<siteurl>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<Space Key>/overview

Navigating to the above URL will take you to a spaces Overview page.

However, selecting the Overpage link provides the page ID in the URL

https://<Site Url>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<Space Key>/overview?homepageId=\{Content ID}

This should be removed for cleaner URL
fields.summary: Selecting the overview page link on a page provides Content ID

fields.description:
Currently, in the Confluence documentation, adding a table within the numbered list restarts the order from 1. 

This becomes inconvenient to add organized tabular information within the list.
fields.summary: Adding a table should be possible within a numbered list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With an image inside of a layout, setting the image to wrap right or left will make the image to be displayed smaller on view mode, differently from edit mode where it's displayed correclty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add a layout (let's say two columns)
# Add an image inside of the right column and set the image to Wrap right
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The image should keep the same size as edit mode

h3. Actual Results
The image is significantly smaller:
* Edit mode:
|  !edit.png|thumbnail!  |
* View Mode:
|  !view.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
Set the image to align instead of wrap
fields.summary: Setting an image to wrap inside of a layout significantly reduces the image's size on view mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Issue Macro not loading issue summary in Task Report Macro under assigned to me task.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a page and inserted a few [tasks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/add-formatting-to-your-page-724764836.html]
 # Step 2 Each of the tasks has a [Jira Issue Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html] in it and they should look something like below:
 !image-2020-04-08-22-31-00-363.png|thumbnail! 
# Step 3 Create another page in the same space and insert a Task Report Macro to show tasks from the page created above.
 !image-2020-04-08-22-32-23-577.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Task Report Macro will show the Jira Issue's Summary for all Jira Issues in *assigned to me* tab.

h3. Actual Results
Task Report Macro is not loading the Jira Issue's Summary for all Jira Issues in *assigned to me* tab.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro not loading issue summary in assigned to me task tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Code macro if you change the text font size to 80 % line numbering is not aligned

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert Code Macro into a page
 # Change font/text size on the browser to 80%

h3. Expected Results
line numbering should still be aligned

h3. Actual Results
The line number is not aligned causing confusion as to what line a user can be referencing. 

See ~ line 14 in attached image.


h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Code Macro line alignment changes when placing text font size to 80%

fields.description: Add and delete multiple rows in a table in the new editor
fields.summary: Add/delete multiple rows in a table

fields.description:
I had a look at the following pages - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/blueprints-323982376.html]

 

We can create blueprints/templates that will allow users to select them to get started with their work. After the page is created, user can completely modify that template and can write his/her own custom content.

Is there some way in which we can force the user to adhere to the template they have selected ? Can we have form-like controls that will give us (the template creator) to perform validations on the input data being provided in the form variables (maybe invoke a javascript function when the value gets changed) ? Also the fields created by the template like tables, textboxes, etc should not be deleted by the user completely.

 

Please let me know if it is supported by confluence or we can have this custom behavior after creating custom plugins.
fields.summary: Do we have a feature to create forms in confluence ?

fields.description:
I had a look at the following pages - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/blueprints-323982376.html]

 

We can create blueprints/templates that will allow users to select them to get started with their work. After the page is created, user can completely modify that template and can write his/her own custom content.

Is there some way in which we can force the user to adhere to the template they have selected ? Can we have form-like controls that will give us (the template creator) to perform validations on the input data being provided in the form variables (maybe invoke a javascript function when the value gets changed) ? Also the fields created by the template like tables, textboxes, etc should not be deleted by the user completely.

 

Please let me know if it is supported by confluence or we can have this custom behavior after creating custom plugins.
fields.summary: Do we have a feature to create forms in confluence ?

fields.description:
The latest update includes an auto formatting feature on all hyperlinks with an internal destination which replaces the link title with the title of the referenced document and displays the link in a formatted box with an icon.

Enabling "Disable Autocomplete" and "Disable Autoformat" under Settings > Editor have no effect to this behaviour.

*PLEASE* give us the ability to turn this annoying, time-consuming (yet very pretty) feature off!
fields.summary: Ability to disable auto format on hyperlinks in editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When performing a search after a page title, two links are returned, one is the correct page link, but there is also a second link which returns a Page Not found error. 

This issue only happened when the users migrated their space twice. The first import is a test run, so users deleted the spaces for the first import, they imported the space again, and the search results now contain deleted page links from the first import.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import a Confluence space with some pages
# Delete the space
# Import the space again
# Search after a page title
# Notice that two links are displayed

h3. Expected Results

The search should only return the new page as the old one no longer exists.

h3. Actual Results

The search return two pages and one of them throws a page not found when accessed.
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-07 at 17.15.23.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Search returns deleted page links when Space is imported twice

fields.description:
On mobile, you can currently switch/access multiple sites within a single account, but to access sites across accounts, you will need to log out and re-login.

This suggestion tracks the request for accessing sites from multiple Atlassian accounts (with different email addresses ) on the mobile app.
fields.summary: Switch Among Sites across Multiple Accounts on Mobile

fields.description:
In Confluence, when a link to an existing page is pasted into a page, it will be automatically converted to a smart card with the page's title, like the screenshot below:

!smart.png|thumbnail!

Due to the fact that this is a smart card based on a URL, the title will not be reflected in a search. For example, if the smart card is inside a page and the user tries to search for its title inside the space including this page, the search will not reflect this result if the page is in a different space.

As a workaround, the user can search for the corresponding URL for the page that becomes a smart card. This is a suggestion to allow the search to reflect smart cards as well.
fields.summary: Allow the search to include results from smart cards

fields.description:
When placing and Excerpt-Include within a surrounding frame (Layout, Table, Excerpt )you are not able to change the width options for the excerpt. 

There should be an option to inherit the width option of the Excerpt from the originating page. Examples below.
fields.summary: Allow Excerpt-Include to Inherit Width setting from the Excerpt

fields.description: Currently, in Legacy Editor, WebP images are not displayed properly. So support WebP images to be displayed properly.
fields.summary: Support WebP Image on Legacy Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inserting heading on a page, heading links doesn't update when the Heading Text is updated. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the page and scroll down to the heading.
# Hover over the heading to reveal the link icon to the left of the heading.
# Click the link icon to copy the link.
# Navigate to and edit the page where you want to link to the heading.
# Paste the URL in the link tool pop-up and give it a more friendly name if desired.
# Navigate to the same page and heading in Step 1. Edit the Heading Text.

h3. Expected Results
- Heading Links should update when the Heading Text is updated.

h3. Actual Results
- Heading Links doesn't update when the Heading Text is updated. This will result in broken heading links.

h3. Notes
- If I link a heading which is above the current link on the same page, the redirection moves the page upwards but puts the top menu bar in front of the title so you have to scroll up to see where you are.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Heading Links doesn't update when the Heading Text is updated

fields.description: Allow notification for pages that has both Viewing and Editing Restrictions on for the subscribed space on slack. Currently, pages that have Viewing restrictions cannot be subscribed.
fields.summary: Slack notification for pages for Restricted Pages.

fields.description:
Each Connect app is associated with a system user. Customer administrators and app vendors used to manage the permission of these apps using the standard Confluence user administration pages (site-wide and space-specific). The site-wide user management page no longer exposes system apps in the users and groups pages which makes it difficult to manage their permissions on a site-wide basis. 

Under this issue, it is requested that the Confluence team reviews how the permission of app users should be managed by customers and subsequently publishes a guide.
fields.summary: Explanation of Confluence Connect app user permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A number of email notifications are showing a message "Error rendering diff:". This issue happens when we edit a page and save it. sometimes, we receive the page edit email notification with diff timeout message. Please see the attachment.

*This issue is difficult to reproduce* *though*, but we can see the diff timeout error in splunk logs for hello and prod. Here is the dashboard : [https://splunk.paas-inf.net/en-US/app/search/hot89196_clone.|https://splunk.paas-inf.net/en-US/app/search/hot89196_clone]

The root cause of this error is calculateDiff() function. The exception is thrown from here:  [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence/browse/confluence-core/confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/diff/DaisyHtmlDiffer.java#142]

confluence-notifications plugin calls this calculateDiff() function internally. This function is also called when we go to page history and compare two versions.

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Edit a page and save it.
 # We should receive, page edit notification
 # Page edit email notification doesn't contain the diff, but a message "Error rendering diff during daisydiff. with timeout 40000"
 # However, the easier way to figure out this issue would be by stack trace in dashboard above. 

h3. Expected Results

Page edit email should contain diff of the change in the content.
h3. Actual Results

Page edit email notification doesn't contain the diff, but a message "Error rendering diff during daisydiff. with timeout 40000"
h3. Workaround

The diff is currently excluded from the page edited notification email if diff generation times out.
fields.summary: Content diff failures causing page edit email notification to time out after 40 secs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a bulleted or numbered list, it's not possible to past 6 levels of indentation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using the new editor
# Create a bulleted or numbered list
# Try to create more than 6 levels 

h3. Expected Results
It should be possible to create more than 6 levels of indentation

h3. Actual Results
The list is limited to 6 levels:
| !Screen Shot 2020-04-06 at 13.31.42.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
Currently, the available workaround is to copy 2 bullets/ numbers from the list and paste them in the last level. This will allow more levels of indentation:
|  !indent_list_workaround.gif|width=800! |
fields.summary: Lists can't be indented more than 6 levels on the new editor

fields.description: We'd love to see the new editor templates ([https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/templates]) on iPad/mobile when creating Pages in addition to being able to use them in the browser.
fields.summary: Create pages with Confluence Templates on iPad/Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When selecting the *** (ellipsis) at the top of the page if there is a need to scroll down to select the options towards the bottom the menu disappears

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select the *** (ellipsis)
# Scroll down

h3. Expected Results
The Ellipsis menu should stay until it is actively exited out of by the user

h3. Actual Results
Menu disappears once you scroll


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ellipsis menu disappears when scrolling on the page

fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario
* Admins can configure how users join their instance, however some functionalities that are missing for finer control over site/product access. For example, Admins can set their instance to allow users to invite other users, or even allow certain domains to joining their instance automatically but on some occasions, Admins may not want users requesting access to their site/product all the time

h3. Suggested solution
* Allow Admins to disable the "Request site/product Access" functionality on their instance [https://admin.atlassian.com/s/xxxxxxxx/access-requests]
fields.summary: Improve "Request site / product Access" functionality

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- If an inline comment has been added to the text inside the Expand macro, it would be difficult to know this when viewing the page as the Expand macro does not expand the text automatically to show you the comment. 

h3. Suggested Solution
- Text in Expand macro should automatically be expanded when it has an inline comments
fields.summary: Text in Expand macro should automatically be expanded when it has an inline comments

fields.description:
Perms quick wins: Rollout phase 3.

This feature seeks to implement better error handling for pages in spaces, as described here: [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CP/pages/635822238/Perms+Quick+Wins] (Phase 3)

The design document for this feature can be mostly found here: [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CP/pages/655823364/Design+plan+page+perm+quick+wins]

PR: [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence/pull-requests/15160/overview]

GraphQL PR: [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/cc-graphql/pull-requests/1124/confcloud-69745-updating-graphql-schema]
fields.summary: Perms quick wins: Better error handling

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When uploading files to a page, even for small files (around 15MB), if the network is a bit unstable, the upload will suddenly fail. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any page and go to *•••* -> *Attachments*
# Drag and drop a file there

h3. Expected Results
The file should take longer in an unstable network but still be uploaded 

h3. Actual Results
Even a small hiccup in the network stops the upload with the following error:
{code:none}Error connecting to server{code}
|  !Screen Shot 2020-04-03 at 20.36.09.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attachments upload is not reliable on unstable networks

fields.description:
{panel:title=THIS TICKET IS NOT MONITORED. PLEASE SEE RELEVANT TICKETS BELOW|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
*Status Update 28 July 2021*
 Hi all,

This is Ethan from the Atlassian Editor Team. Thank you for the continuous feedback on performance improvement needs within the Confluence editing experience. This is a top priority for Atlassian teams. 

I want to direct your attention to some new tickets that have been created to provide more focused updates on specific performance related issues. We will be actively monitoring the tickets below, and ask that you you to vote and follow the tickets which detail the specific performance issue affecting you and your team:
||Theme||Ticket||
|1. Slowness rendering Non-Content PAGE FEATURES when VIEWING a Confluence page |CONFCLOUD-72517|
|2. Slowness rendering IN-PAGE CONTENT when VIEWING a large Confluence page|CONFCLOUD-72518|
|3. Slowness initially rendering a large Confluence page in EDIT mode|CONFCLOUD-72519|
|4. Keyboard typing delays while trying to EDIT a Confluence page|CONFCLOUD-72520|
|5. Changes are lost and unsaved after EDITING a Confluence page|CONFCLOUD-72521|
|6. Inability or delay of publishing EDITS to a Confluence page|CONFCLOUD-72522|

 

Because not all performance issues stem from the same cause, we are aggregating potentially disparate issues within this ticket. We can continue to do so with your help in providing additional details on what your page contains. If you are able to remove elements and see performance improvements, sharing that information can help us narrow our focus on key elements that are slowing page performance.

Thanks all and stay safe,

Ethan
{panel}
 

We are experiencing very slow page load time. Looks like it's not only us but lots of users are seeing same experience. See this thread (has 6.4k views as of April 2020)  [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Jira-and-Confluence-Cloud-is-toooooo-slow/qaq-p/744373|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Jira-and-Confluence-Cloud-is-toooooo-slow/qaq-p/744373#U1340387]

Top poster even posted Google pagespeed score of 4.

We measured our instance and it has page speed score of 13 for mobile and 27 for desktop. I think this is too low for such a top product like Confluence or Jira. See report: [https://developers.google.com/speed/pagespeed/insights/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbitwelt.atlassian.net%2Fwiki%2Fspaces%2Fbit%2Foverview%3Fmode%3Dglobal&tab=desktop]

We have another private instance where about 500 JS files are loaded on each page load. A lot of them seem to come from team calendar (which we have disabled but js files are still loaded), see screenshot.

Please prioritize page speed/performance.
fields.summary: Confluence is very slow, please improve the performance

fields.description:
The task is not getting created, hence they are not receiving notification.

We have two scenarios here,
{panel}
 * The task assigned to a team( created from people directory) &
 * The task assigned to multiple users{panel}
*Steps to reproduce the first scenario:*
 1. Create a team from people directory and assign this team to a task.

Expected behavior:
 The task will be assigned to all the team members and hence will get a notification.
 Also, they will see the task listed profile -> Tasks

Actual behavior:
 The task is not getting assigned to other team members apart from the creator and that's why there is no notification for other team members.
 Note: If mention a user directly instead of a team, the task gets assigned to the user and gets an email notification.

*Steps to reproduce the second scenario:*
 Create a task and assign multiple users to it.

Expected behavior:
 The task will be assigned to all users and they can see task listed in profile->tasks, hence will receive a notification.

Actual behavior: 
 The task is getting created only for the first-mentioned user and hence email notification is triggering for him only.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!


Workaround:
At this time we have no workaround.
fields.summary: Task is not getting created for all members hence they are not receiving notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Atlassian add-on [Microsoft OneDrive for Business (Beta)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221882/microsoft-onedrive-for-business-beta?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] can't open documents inside of onedrive's shared drive/ library.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the [Microsoft OneDrive for Business (Beta)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221882/microsoft-onedrive-for-business-beta?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] add-on
 # Add the *Microsoft OneDrive for Business* macro to the page
 # Insert a link to a document inside of a shared drive
 # Save the macro and publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The document should be shown
h3. Actual Results

An error message is shown:
{quote}!https://cc-office365.services.atlassian.com/img/lock.svg|width=100!
 We can’t open this document for the currently logged-in user

If this document is password-protected, you’ll need to open it in OneDrive. If it’s not, you may not have permission in OneDrive to view it, or it may belong to a different organization’s account.

Switch accounts
  
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only available workaround is to move or copy the document to a normal drive and use the copy.
fields.summary: Microsoft OneDrive for Business add-on macro can't display documents inside of shared library

fields.description: Adding more details.
fields.summary: Integrate cc-services in connie launcher

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Connect macros should be sent context parameters to the request URL of the backend/host application. In normal page views, this works fine; however, on pages that are viewed in Page History (i.e. viewing previous version of a page) that contain Connect macros, the context parameter *space.id* is not sent.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Connect macro that contains the *{space.key}* context parameter in the request URL.
 # Create a new page, and add that Connect macro.
 # Make at least one change (so there's a history).
 # Go to *Page History* function and pick version (previous to CURRENT) that has the Connect macro.
 # Check your backend app logs and notice that *{space.key}* was not sent.

h3. Expected Results

Request received on your backend app should include the *space.key*.
h3. Actual Results

*space.key* is not passed.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Connect macros rendered in Page History are not being passed space.id context parameter

fields.description: Currently, the new features are rolled out for all the customers, there should be a way that site-admins should be able to test the new feature and send out to the instance for other users to work on the feature.
fields.summary: Site-Admins should have the ability to send out the newly rolled out feature.

fields.description:
This request is to change the behavior of the notifications for the default overview page automatically created when you create your first space in an instance. 

As of today, it triggers a notification in the Activity Feed as an Anonymous user, which can be confusing. 

The suggestion is to change the Anonymous user to the user that created the space or identify the content as a dummy content.
fields.summary: Change the default overview page for the first space created notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pasting text from MS-Powerpoint to the page, replace everything on the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with some text, macros. Publish the page
# And re-open the page in edit mode.
# Now, copy some text from MS-PowerPoint, paste it to the confluence page(opened in edit mode)
Every content that existed on the page, gets replaced by the new text(copied from the MS PowerPoint)

h3. Expected Results
The text on the confluence page must remain intact.
h3. Actual Results
The text on the confluence page gets replaced by the new copied text.


h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pasting text from MS-PowerPoint to the page, replace everything on the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a project is created in JSD and a new space is created through JSD associating to the project, the overview page is created with old editor; while any other pages later added to space have new editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project in JSD
 # Click on 'Connect a space' .
 # Select option 'Create new Confluence space'. Enter new space name and 'Create'.
 # Check on Confluence side, the 'Overview page' is created in old editor.

h3. Expected Results

The Overview page should be created with new editor
h3. Actual Results

The Overview page is getting created with old editor, while any new page added in Space is with new editor.
h3. Workaround

Any new page with new editor can be created and be set as 'Overview page' in Space Settings.
fields.summary: Creating new space associated with project through JSD has Overview page in old editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence will trigger a frontend error if the spacekey contains the word 'overview'. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 Create a space and add the word *overview* in the spacekey

h3. Expected Results
Space is created and we are sent to the main overview page

h3. Actual Results
Space is created however we aren't sent to the main overview page

 !image-2020-04-02-17-05-15-377.png|thumbnail! 

{quote}
Something went wrong
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support and be sure to give them this code: hcu0sc.

Reload this page
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Change the spacekey by following the steps described in the [CONFCLOUD\-2085: Rename Space Key|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2085] feature request.
fields.summary: Problems with overview keyword in the spacekey

fields.description:
*Background*

When using the "Approve following domains" option at the site level to provide site access to users we don't have the option to disable email notifications sent to site admins.  Currently, all the site admin will receive an email notification when a new user gets access. Many of the site admins don't wish to receive these notifications. 

It will be helpful to allow configuration to disable these notifications and allow to configure which site admin gets the notification.
fields.summary: Option to configure which site-admin should get email notification an email when a new account gets access.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Search API results order intermittently changes from request to request (using the same query). The impact that this issue can have on data quality and user experience is significant, in that paginating through search result data could lead to presenting/processing duplicate data, or data omission (a result being skipped).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open your favorite web browser (JSON-formatter plugin helpful, but optional)
 # Open the following search API request 7 to 10 times (into different tabs): [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/latest/content/search?expand=space&limit=10&start=5&cql=space%3DMAR+and+type%3Dpage|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/latest/content/search?expand=space&limit=1&start=1&cql=space%3DMAR+and+type%3Dpage]
 # Observe results between the tabs

h3. Expected Results

Search result order will be identical for each request.
h3. Actual Results

Search result order varies intermittently. 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Content search REST API calls returns results in different order creating pagination issues leading to duplicate or omitted results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a blog post, it will use the instance's timezone instead of the user's one to set the date of the blogpost.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new instance in the Tokyo timezone
# Change the computer's timezone to Americas
# Create a new blogpost

h3. Expected Results
The blogpost should be placed inside the user's current day

h3. Actual Results
The blogpost is placed inside of the instance's current day:
|  !Screen Shot 2020-04-01 at 14.12.29.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Blog post is created in the wrong date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to add any user in the restricted permissions on a page, if it has a deleted group in the list, after you hit apply to save changes, you receive a error message:

"There was an error submitting the page restrictions. Please try again later."

It happens regardless of having full permissions in the space, space admin or site-Admin rights.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group and add it to a restricted page
 # Delete the group created
 # Add a user to the restricted page

h3. Expected Results

Able to add user in the restriction page list
h3. Actual Results

Not able to add user to the restrictions page list.
h3. Workaround

Remove the deleted group from the restriction's page list, will able to add users as expected.
fields.summary: [REGRESSION]Trying to add users with a deleted group in a restricted page list  returns an error

fields.description:
At the moment, task notifications only includes the page name without the space information. 

 !task notification.png|thumbnail! 

In some cases, the end users work with multiple spaces in Confluence and without the space information, there is less context on where the tasks are coming from. 

Suggestion :

Allow the space key to be included on task notifications.
fields.summary: Allow the space key to be included on task notifications.
Pages with indented Action Items fail to convert to the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sending a request to the [PUT /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-api-content-id-put] REST API endpoint in order to update a page fails returning below error message if no value is present/provided for the user-agent header:
{quote}
"Content body cannot be converted to new editor format" error when updating page content
{quote} 

However:
# According to [RFC 7231|http://svn.tools.ietf.org/svn/wg/httpbis/specs/rfc7231.html#header.user-agent] the user agent is not mandatory (it says it should, not must): {quote}
A user agent SHOULD send a User-Agent field in each request unless specifically configured not to do so.{quote}
# The error message returned is misleading and does not help understand what the problem is (it should mention: no user agent or something similar)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update a page content sending a  PUT request to the /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id} endpoint without providing any user-agent header.
 

h3. Expected Results
The page gets updated, or you get an error message saying that you must provide a value for the user-agent in order to be able to update content

h3. Actual Results
You get status code 400 (bad request), that is correct, but the returned error message is totally misleading:
{quote}
"Content body cannot be converted to new editor format" error when updating page content
{quote}

The below exception is found in the logs:
{noformat}
2020-03-27 13:37:06.521 ERROR com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.DefaultRenderer Error rendering content for view: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (null)   

com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (null)

com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.atlassiandocformat.StorageXhtmltoADFTransformer.transform(StorageXhtmltoADFTransformer.java:115)
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.DefaultRenderer.renderWithoutMetrics(DefaultRenderer.java:188)
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.DefaultRenderer.renderWithResult(DefaultRenderer.java:145)
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.DefaultFormatConverter.convertToAtlasDocFormatWithResult(DefaultFormatConverter.java:174)
com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.ContentBodyConversionManagerImpl.computeConvertedValue(ContentBodyConversionManagerImpl.java:400)
[.....]
org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

 Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: 
java.util.regex.Matcher.getTextLength(Matcher.java:1283)
java.util.regex.Matcher.reset(Matcher.java:309)
java.util.regex.Matcher.<init>(Matcher.java:229)
java.util.regex.Pattern.matcher(Pattern.java:1093)
com.atlassian.confluence.mobile.MobileUtils.getIosAppVersion(MobileUtils.java:33)
[...]
... 367 more

2020-03-27 13:37:06.521 WARN com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.ContentBodyConversionManagerImpl Could not convert storage format to atlas_doc_format  format using ceo with id : -1    
{noformat}


h3. Workaround

None, you must provide a value for the user agent.
fields.summary: Using REST API to update a page fails with a misleading error message if no user-agent is provided

fields.description:
*Problem use case:*

From time to time, I can not find content in our Confluence spaces because it ended up (by somebody else, or by me) in a page that I created only to have a navigation tree structure. As a result I am not clicking on the right pages.

Similarly, I sometimes am looking for content in pages that are empty (because they only serve tree structure prupose) but I find out they are empty only after clicking them.

*Request:*

It would be helpful if *empty* pages in the Confluence navigation sidebar would be shown distinctively, e.g. with a dimmed color.

This would help to:
 * easily spot pages that only exist for the purpose of creating a tree structure, and thus are not intended to have text. (and thus a user should not click to open)
 * easily spot pages that exist for the purpose of creating a tree structure but nonetheless do have text.  (and thus a user should not forget to click when looking for potential content)
 * easily spot pages that are meant as a sort template structure but have not yet been used or filled in. 
A template structure could be that under a page "Requirements" you always want to have 3 subpages: "User requirements", "Legal requirements", "Performance requirements". Only the ones that are in use will clearly stand out

As a result, distinctively coloring pages in the navigation sidebar that have content versus no content, allows for fewer useless mouse clicks.
fields.summary: Indicate empty pages distinctively in Confluence navigation sidebar

fields.description:
Search option for page in Confluence mobile app

Attached is the screenshot of reference:

Andriod mobile app: In page view, it would be helpful to customers if we have a search option/button enabled. In lengthy pages, if the user is looking for a specific topic or a word it will work as ctrl+F.

Right now the search option on-page is the global search

example:
* This is a Decision log page which contains a word *record*. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

* Searching a word record shows all the possible pages that contain the word record or have present in the title i.e its searching globally but not on the page. 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

So need to create a second option search specifically for the page.
fields.summary: Search option for page in Confluence mobile app

fields.description:
Find and replace the URLs mentioned in the hyperlinks.

As of now, we can find/replace the text/hyperlinks but not the URL mentioned within the hyperlink.
fields.summary: Find and replace the URLs mentioned in the hyperlinks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- In using Task Report Macro, using the *Assigned to* parameter will only display the tasks assigned to the user who was first mentioned instead of displaying tasks assigned to all users specified. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a task and mention  User A and User B. 
# Create a task report macro on another page and use the *Assigned to* parameter to display the tasks assigned to User B. 
# Create another task report macro and use the *Assigned to* parameter to display the tasks assigned to User A. 

h3. Expected Results
-  *Assigned to* parameter should display the tasks assigned to all users specified. 

h3. Actual Results
- *Assigned to* parameter will only display the tasks assigned to the user who was first mentioned. 


h3. Workaround
- Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Assigned to parameter in Task Report Macro doesn't display tasks assigned to ALL users specified.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary We have recently added some cool new templates within Confluence Cloud (you can check further details on this Atlassian Community post: [A new create flow and templates experience is coming to Confluence Cloud!|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/A-new-create-flow-and-templates-experience-is-coming-to/ba-p/1302116]). They are pretty cool, we know, but even so, sometimes we always want to change a default template to give our company's personal touch to it, so that's why we have the edit option on default templates. For some of these new templates we have implemented on Confluence, we are unable to edit them - they just keep loading in the browser. h3. Steps to Reproduce # From your Confluence homepage, go to *Settings > Global Templates and Blueprints* # Click over the *Edit* button on any of the below templates: * AWS architecture diagram * Business status update * Premortem * Brainstorming * Customer impact assessment * Experiment planning sample-bp1-name results * Marketing united * Design sprint * Customer interview reports * Default project poster plan index template - Oops - an error has occurred * Executive business review * Writing guidelines * Weekly meeting notes * Leadership team health monitor * Default marketing plan template * Disruptive brainstorming * Interview feedback h3. Expected Results The editor opens up and we are able to edit the template. h3. Actual Results A spinning wheel keeps spinning forever at the browser. *Notes*: It is possible to check 3 different errors in the response of the request with file *cgraphql?q=templateEditorContent* that we can receive on these templates: * {code:json} value:
Error: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (Expected ac:placeholder end element but got: )
{code} On the templates: ** AWS architecture diagram ** Business status update ** Premortem ** Brainstorming ** Customer impact assessment ** Experiment planning sample-bp1-name results ** Marketing united ** Design sprint ** Customer interview reports ** Executive business review ** Weekly meeting notes ** Default marketing plan template ** Disruptive brainstorming ** Interview feedback * {code:json}
Error: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (Expected ac:placeholder end element but got: *)
{code} On the templates: ** Leadership team health monitor ** Writing guidelines * And the below one, on the *Default project poster plan index template*: !image-2020-03-31-17-12-23-553.png|width=682,height=250! h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot edit some of the new templates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 When *view field configuration settings* are changed in JIRA for *mandatory fields*, it takes a lot of time to sync with JIRA issue macro in Confluence.

h3. Environment

Confluence
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Page in a view/published mode, select a text and opt for 'create JIRA issue' single or multiple.
# Change *view field configuration settings* in JIRA for mandatory fields.
  Now, *create issue*, the mandatory field will not be seen. It will take a long time to '*view field configuration settings*' to sync with Confluence 'create issue' feature.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA configuration settings must sync well and instantly.

h3. Actual Results

It takes a long time to '*view field configuration settings*' to sync with Confluence 'create issue' feature.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: 'view field configuration settings' in JIRA issue macro takes time to sync

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Create *Multiple JIRA issues* never works.

h3. Environment

Confluence
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Page in a view/published mode, select a text and opt for 'create multiple  JIRA issue'.
 # No issue will be linked eventually.

h3. Expected Results
The *Multiple JIRA issues* option should work as expected.

h3. Actual Results
The option *Multiple JIRA issues* isn't working at all.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create Multiple JIRA issues is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Sometimes, when the JIRA issue is created successfully, it takes a lot of time to load(the wheel keeps spinning).

h3. Environment

Confluence
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Page in a view/published mode, select a text and opt for 'create JIRA issue' single or multiple.

h3. Expected Results
The JIRA issue should be loaded well in a go.

h3. Actual Results
The JIRA issue doesn't load, the wheel keeps spinning.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Currently, Confluence Cloud for Slack app(https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-for-slack-956709523.html) is provided only in English.
Since the product itself is provided in [several languages|https://ja.confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/languages-744721667.html], it would be great if the Slack app is localized as well.

Ref: https://api.slack.com/start/designing/localizing#what
fields.summary: Localize the Slack app

fields.description: It would be good to allow notifications to include an entire family of pages - so you can opt to watch a page and be notified if it changes, if any of its children change, or if any child page is added or removed.
fields.summary: Watch Page and Children

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When navigating in the space directory, the first column we have there calls *Space* and shows us the space logo. Though, it is read as "_logo_", independent of which is the logo in fact.

h3. Suggestion
* Similar as [CONFCLOUD\-69698: JAWS screenreader: images are misread across the site|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-69698], it should read what the image represents, as WCAG 1.1.1 suggests.
fields.summary: JAWS screenreader: space logo column, on space directory, doesn't get properly read

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the keystroke to navigate in the site, the shortcuts bring us to different results than the keystroke we used.

h3. Suggestion
* Improve the keystroke elements with more accuracy.
fields.summary: JAWS screenreader: keyboard shortcuts accuracy

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When reading an image from a page or any other location within the site, the graphic is read as a string composed of characters and numbers.

h3. Suggestion
* Announce what the image represents, as the WCAG 1.1.1 and 2.4.6 suggest, labeling the graphic contents in the site.
fields.summary: JAWS screenreader: images are misread across the site

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Currently, when creating a new space on Confluence and the space templates modal pops-up, it lands the mouse cursor on the tab and cursor is locked, so there is no way to proceed with the space creation.

h3. Suggestion
Place the cursor over the *Blank Space* template, in a way that it is unlocked to go further in the next templates, as WCAG 2.1.2 suggests.
fields.summary: JAWS screenreader: cursor misplacing on space templates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an Expand macro is in a table, it's not possible to insert bullet points.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in Confluence using the new editor.
 # Create a table. 
 # Inside of the table, type / insert an Expand macro.
 # Attempt to add a bullet or numbered list inside of the Expand macro. The option is greyed out.
 # Create a bullet or numbered list outside of the table, copy that list, then paste it into the Expand macro. The Expand macro will include the first item, with no bullet or number. The remaining items display beneath the expand macro.

h3. Expected Results

_Example on Legacy editor:_

!legacy-editor.gif|width=501,height=348!
h3. Actual Results

_Example on New editor:_

_!new-editor.gif|width=501,height=364!_
h3. Workaround

No current workaround on the new editor.
fields.summary: Insert bullet or numbered list inside an expand macro in a table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary If a page (A) has a title similar to {color:red}{{--Xxxx Xxxxxxx Xxxx (Xxxxxxxxx Xxxxxx) / Xxxxxx / Xxxxxx Xxxxxx (3xx Xxxxx Xxxxxxxx Xxxx)  (XXXX)}}{color}, when inserting a link to that page (A) on another page (B), the link will cause the page (B) to break after publishing. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page with the title {color:red}{{--Xxxx Xxxxxxx Xxxx (Xxxxxxxxx Xxxxxx) / Xxxxxx / Xxxxxx Xxxxxx (3xx Xxxxx Xxxxxxxx Xxxx)  (XXXX)}}{color} and publish it # Create a new page # Insert a link (command+K) to the first page # Publish the second page h3. Expected Results It should work as expected h3. Actual Results * The page will break with the following error: {quote}(x) We couldn't display your content Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Atlassian Support{quote} * It won't be possible to edit the page * The following error is thrown at the console: {code:none}ContentRenderer.tsx:29 Invalid adf document SyntaxError: Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0 at Object.parse () at ContentRenderer.tsx:26 at ContentRenderer.tsx:60 at u (react-components.esm.js:9) at Wo (react-dom.production.min.js:150) at Oi (react-dom.production.min.js:166) at Ti (react-dom.production.min.js:179) at Fa (react-dom.production.min.js:232) at Ua (react-dom.production.min.js:233) at xu (react-dom.production.min.js:249){code} * The request {color:#00875A}{{instance.atlassian.net/cgraphql?q=QueryPreloader_ContentRendererQuery}}{color} responds with: {code:none}(...)value: "
Error: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Title must not be null or empty.
" (...){code} h3. Workaround The available workaround is to rename the source page to something simpler.
fields.summary: Inserting a link to a page with certain titles will break the page where the link was inserted
Images failing to load on an expand macro inside a table cell

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the backticks (`) to make a sentence monospaced, the backticks are cutting the first character of the sentence and both backticks are kept in there. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a ` 
 # Insert any text after it
 # Insert another ` and press space

h3. Expected Results

The text should turn to monospaced. 
h3. Actual Results

The backticks are kept and the first letter is cut off as you can see in the video below:

[^backtick.mp4]
h3. Workaround

In general, this bug only happens when you are using the "U.S. - International - PC" keyboard configuration. Changing it to "U.S." in your keyboard preferences should fix it.
fields.summary: Backtick shortcut is cutting the first letter of the word and keeping the backticks

fields.description:
With Confluence new navigation and customized *Site Homepage* set in the admin portal, we will have two options: custom homepage & new Home experience.

The custom homepage will continue to function as it is. Users can still click the Confluence logo, your custom site logo, or the top nav menu item for the custom Homepage to access it.

The new Home experience is complementary to the custom Homepage. It provides each user a more personalized experience and one-stop-shop to everything that matters to them, such as favorite spaces and recent pages and what's happening around them in Confluence.

These two tabs cause confusion for the customer base who use different language. For instance, In German, the two tabs will be translated as "Wiki Startseite" + "Startseite"

This is where the problem occurs for a German userbase because users will be confused which button actually leads to the intended homepage. Moreover, user's will by chance click on the "Startseite" (Dashboard) button and land on the default dashboard which is not the intended homepage for this Confluence.

*Suggestion:*

Can we have a dashboard option enfolding both home pages (default & custom) there like in Jira navigation bar
fields.summary: With new navigation, can we have dashboard option available like Jira

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Navigating in Confluence sometimes can be time-consuming. When working between different spaces or even page trees within the same space, manually navigating through the sidebar can drive us to lose a bit of time searching for the pages.

h2. Suggestion
* Implement a navigation system within Confluence that works similar to what we have on OSs like Windows, for example, with functionalities like:
** *Up*: to go to the parent page of the page we are in;
** *Back*: to go back to the previous page we were;
** *Forward*: to go further in the page tree.
fields.summary: Navigation buttons

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Currently, while navigating on Confluence pages, if we are in page *X* and want to go back to the previous Confluence page we were, we can only get there by clicking over the *Back* button of our browser or searching for it in the page tree.
If we wish to do the same, but for a page next to the current one we are, then we can only do this by searching for the page.

h2. Suggestion
* Include *Previous* and *Next* buttons within Confluence, so the navigation experience can be improved while accessing pages in the spaces.
fields.summary: Previous/Next buttons

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- Inserting link to open an application will add http(s) or www to actually save the link (which doesn't work for app links).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Copy the URL of your application (eg. application/go)
# Paste the URL in the link tool pop-up where ever you want it to appear on the page. 

h3. Expected Results
- Confluence should retain the URL that was used to create the link. (eg. application/go)

h3. Actual Results
- Confluence is forces http(s) or www to actually save the link (which doesn't work for app links). (eg. http://applicatio/go)

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Force URL formatting limits functionality

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a Confluence Tiny link on a page in the Legacy editor the page title is not automatically resolving. 
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy a Tiny link from the Share menu
 # Paste into page in the Legacy editor

h3. Expected Results

Link should automatically convert and display Page title
h3. Actual Results

Conversion does not occur and only the link is displayed
h3. Workaround

Copy the full link from the address bar
fields.summary: Tiny Link on Legacy editor Does not resolve Page title.

fields.description:
Currently, It is not possible to create a numbered page tree in confluence, kindly add the ability to add/create a numbered page tree:
 !image-2020-03-26-11-55-46-774.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to create numbered page tree in confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the highlighting text option to create JIRA issues from a Confluence page, though the issue is correctly created, it doesn't show the JIRA link on the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Confluence page;
# Highlight some text and select *Create issue* option;
# Create the JIRA issue.

h3. Expected Results
After creating the issue, the page reloads and the *JIRA Links* button is shown at the top of the page, linking it to the just created issue.

h3. Actual Results
The page reloads, but the JIRA issue link is not there.

*Notes* 
* In the JIRA issue, the page is also not linked there.

h3. Workaround
Copy the JIRA issue URL and paste it into the Confluence page (you can also manually link the page within the JIRA issue).
fields.summary: Create JIRA issue from Confluence is not linking the ticket on the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customers aren't able to create the Jira Issue from the Highlight Inline Create Jira Issue
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select some text on Confluence page
 # Click Create Issue

!image-2020-03-25-15-30-22-819.png|width=485,height=194!
h3. Expected Results
 * Issue is created 
 * Issue is linked on page 

h3. Actual Results
 * Issue is created (/)
 * Issue is *not* linked on page (x)

h3. Workaround

No workaround yet. It will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to Create Jira Issue via Highlighted text menu popup

fields.description:
Background for my suggestion:

All of the other configurations and schemes seem to prevent outside influence, except for fields. If I spend the time to individually show/hide the fields, through the current arduous process, to create a specific field configuration and associate it with a scheme, shouldn't it only be affected by directly modifying it? However, if a custom field is created it will not only appear in the setup I just created, but all other setups in our Jira instance.

What is the point in configurations and schemes for fields then? When creating a custom field, one of the steps is to select a screen to associate it with but there is no step to select a field configuration to associate it with. Afterwards the field you create will perpetuate itself throughout all the configurations.

Suggestions:
 # When creating a field configuration, would it be possible to do this as a bulk selection process instead of showing/hiding one field at a time?
 # When creating a custom field, would it be possible to have an additional step to select the field configurations you would like to associate it with?
 # With the help of suggestion 2, if Jira's base behavior was set to hide all incoming custom fields, then current field configurations would not be affected by the creation of new fields. This will add value to the setup of fields, as they are currently affected by indirect influences where all the other setups are not.
fields.summary: Field Configuration Functionality

fields.description:
Currently there is no ability for apps to retrieve a user's time zone via the REST API. Vendors have requested this ability via [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/confluence-cloud-time-zone-get-via-rest-api/35954/2]. In contrast, [Jira does provide this ability|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-user-get]. 

When looking into this, keep in mind user privacy considerations such as outlined in [this community thread|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/weekly-gdpr-api-status-development-update-february-13th/26978].
fields.summary: Add the ability to retrieve a user's time zone from the REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When inserting a *Task Report* macro within a table, independent the way you are showing the results, the first macro's cell at the right top corner will get the same color as the cell it is within the table.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have some tasks create around your Confluence site;
 # Create a new page;
 # Insert a table within the page;
 # In any cell, insert a *Task Report* macro (pay attention to the color you have in the cell);
 # Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The *Task Report* macro results are shown with no layout issues.
h3. Actual Results

The color of the first cell in the page (it is usually the _Description_ header) gets its color changed to the same as the table's cell

!image-2020-03-24-16-32-28-179.png|width=602,height=416!
h3. Workaround

If it is possible, remove the *Task Report* macro from within the table.
fields.summary: Task Report macro within a table gets the cell color

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Jira Macro parameters don't reflect while editing the existing macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a new page with the new editor in Confluence cloud
 * Add the Jira macro with a JQL (e.g. filter: "key=JIRA-123")
 * Publish the page
 * Edit the page
 * Try to reconfigure Jira macro added in step 2
 * Save the changes in the Jira macro editor and observe the fault behavior (i.e. changes in the Jira macro configuration are not saved/not visible in preview)
 * Publish the page and observe the fault behavior (i.e. changes in the Jira macro configuration are not saved/not visible in preview)

h3. Expected Results
 * The new JQL will reflect

h3. Actual Results
 * The new JQL doesn't reflect

h3. Workaround
 * Add another Jira Macro with a new JQL query.
fields.summary: Jira Macro Configuration cannot be changed
